meanings.sent1: The nebulose sky made it hard to see the stars.
meanings.sent2: The morning fog created a nebulose atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The nebulose glass made everything look blurry.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event was nebulose, like a dream.
meanings.sent5: The nebulose mist enveloped the entire valley.

meanings.sent1: His nebulose explanation left us confused.
meanings.sent2: The nebulose figure in the distance was hard to make out.
meanings.sent3: The nebulose directions led us in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts on the matter were nebulose, lacking clarity.
meanings.sent5: The nebulose outline of the mountain faded into the horizon.

meanings.definition: Covered in or resembling a nebula
meanings.sent1: The nebulose painting captured the beauty of outer space.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a nebulose effect using swirling colors.
meanings.sent3: The nebulose costume made her look like a space explorer.
meanings.sent4: The nebulose fabric shimmered like distant stars.
meanings.sent5: The nebulose pattern on the dress was mesmerizing.
